roleset.name: make, devise, with some difficulty, planning technically

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 being engineered, if in addition to arg1
source material, if in addition to arg1

example.name: ordinary transitive
example.text: Mr. Hahn also has engineered a surprising turnaround of Georgia - Pacific .

propbank.arg: a surprising turnaround of Georgia - Pacific

example.name: with 2dy attribute
example.text: Capitalism may now be engineered to withstand sudden shocks , but there are fault lines -- the crisis in profits , the assault on wages , the structural inequity of the system -- that make fools of those who claim that the future is here and that history is over .

example.name: adjectival, sorry
example.text: Mr. Robinson of Delta & Pine , the seed producer in Scott , Miss. , said Plant Genetic 's success in creating genetically engineered male steriles does n't automatically mean it would be simple to create hybrids in all crops .

example.name: just arg1
example.text: At a stroke , by taxing dividends he destroyed private pensions , costing countless trillions , but benefiting the treasury a few billion which he whizzed away on social engineering .

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: Yet opponents fear it will lead to the ? social engineering ? of university admissions , with privately - educated pupils routinely rejected because of the school they attended and less - qualified state school pupils given places on the basis of their ? potential ? .

roleset.note: ENGINEER-V NOTES: Arg numbering dictated by comparison with 'create'; args 2 (sourcematerial) and 3 (benefactive) may appear with more examples. We might as well tag these adjectives now. (from engineer.01-v)
ENGINEERING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, engineer.01. No corresponding VNcls. (from engineering.01-n)
arg2 added due to usage particular to nominalization. (from engineering.01-n)
